chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Edward Reed Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 103 DAYS time served.

miscConds.notes:
- Court set restitution at $0.
- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
- Maintain full time work/school; or combination of both.

- No weapons.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess/own any gun or other firearms.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess/own ammunition 
- Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and he/she may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
- No contact with victim, unless approval of the Court.

- Complete a batters intervention program at the Alma Center.
- Complete a mental health evaluation; comply with any recommended treatment.
- Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
- Provide a DNA sample.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: STAYED and to be used at the discretion of the agent.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Edward Reed Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Edward Reed Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Charles Edward Reed Jr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 103 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS, the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  15 MONTHS.  The defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
 
- Defendant to serve 60 DAYS condition time in the House of Correction, STAYED and to be used at the discretion of the agent.
- Complete a batters intervention program at the Alma Center.
- Complete a mental health evaluation; comply with any recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
- No contact with victim, unless approval of the Court.
- Maintain full time work/school; or combination of both.
- No weapons.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Court set restitution at $0.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess/own any gun or other firearms.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess/own ammunition 
Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and he/she may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Charles Edward Reed Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court for Charles Edward Reed Jr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she must submit a DNA sample and may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his/her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNTS 2, 3, 4, AND 5: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Documentation to be added to this case by defendant.  (Charles E. Reed - #2022006638, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court, defendant Charles Edward Reed not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Plea and Sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requests adjourned hearing date.  Court will leave case scheduled or Jury Trial date, but understand the case may resolve short of trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 9/12/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Martin Russell Tanz in court, defendant Charles Edward Reed not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense's motion to modify bail. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

CASE HEARED IN PRELIM FOR BR 35
Defendant Charles Edward Reed, appear by video in court with attorney Martin Russell Tanz, appear by video.  Defendant Charles Edward Reed in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. Sheets-Walker.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with L.M.S
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Charles Edward Reed in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Charles Edward Reed in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
